byline.contributor: Mujib Mashal contributed reporting from Kabul, Afghanistan.

abstract: Pentagon officials are determining success of unmanned drone strike in Pakistan against Taliban Mullah Akhtar Muhammad Mansour; say attack, if successful, may have removed major driving force behind insurgency.

headline.print_headline: U.S. Drone Attack Targets Taliban Leader
headline.main: U.S. Drone Strike Targets Taliban Leader

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject

snippet: The Pentagon said on Saturday that the United States military was still assessing whether the leader, Mullah Akhtar Muhammad Mansour, was killed in the strike.
lead_paragraph: The Pentagon said on Saturday that the United States military was still assessing whether the leader, Mullah Akhtar Muhammad Mansour, was killed in the strike.
